> [[ Broken Sky Online ]]
> [[ Previous Threads ]]
http://suptg.thisisnotatrueending.com/archive.html?tags=Broken%20Sky
> [[ Unique Identifier: Ascheritte ]]
http://pastebin.com/pZv3XUPQ
> [[ Twitter ]]
https://twitter.com/BrokenSkyOnline

Liza's deception has left your perception of the Averron Alliance a bit fuzzy, but one thing is certain; the Crimson Guardians guild hall is large as it is opulent. You're meandering about outside the halls, and walk onto the edge of the steps, as it's the closest one. It's somewhere between barracks and castle, with a red roof and numerous flags emblazoned with the crimson insignia. You pause, taking a look at the plaque nearby the door.

> [[ Crimson Guardians – Guild Hall ]]
> [[ Guild Leader: Liza ]]
> [[ Guild Officers: Kainzo, Mendicant, Florica ]]
> [[ “ Glory Is Forever ” ]]

You contemplate knocking.

Though, you were meaning to pay the Writ Keepers a visit as well. You were planning on waiting for Ayla, though she presented the option of speaking to Dorian, presumably one of her officers; the notion doesn't sound terribly appealing to you, as what you were planning on talking about pertained, at least somewhat, to her. At the top of the steps to the Guardians' hall, you turn on a heel to head that way. A couple of familiar figures intercept your path, however.

“Ascheritte.” Aelriss waves. The collar of a chain shirt is visible, under the neck of her cloak. Tatsumaki is following close behind; she's wearing a pair of scale gauntlets right now that give off a faint glow of a hazy golden brown. “There you are. What are you doing?”

“Just checking out the guild halls.” You respond. “I heard there was some fighting going on over here, and I was thinking about joining up with a guild anyway.”

“Mm, you were talking to Liza back there, I heard. The Guardians, right?” She sticks her tongue out, screwing up her face for a second at the notion. “Bleh.”

> [[ Continued... ]]
name: Sylvetica
subject: [[ Broken Sky Online Quest - Session 9 ]]

comment:
>>38202767

“Mm, you were talking to Liza back there, I heard. The Guardians, right?” She sticks her tongue out, screwing up her face for a second at the notion. “Bleh.”

“I'm sure they're not all bad.” You raise an eyebrow, looking back at the magnificent guild hall behind you. You're not disinterested: rather, you're still conflicted. Liza's "deception" has left your thoughts of the Alliance a bit fuzzy.

“Mhm. I dunno, I guess I'm just not as hardcore as them. It doesn't sound so appealing to me.” Aelriss shrugs. “I actually wanted to see if the Writ Keepers would take me.”

“Really?” You grin.

“Yeah,” She responds. “Don't get me wrong. I'm not much of a roleplayer. It just sounds fun, y'know?”

“It's alright. You'd like it.” You respond, making your way to the bottom of the stairs to lean against the nearby pillar. Dressing in weapons and armor is still just tiring enough to feel real. You should get back to hunting Celestial Gems soon. “Ayla's really cool.”

“She seemed like it. God, the top guild officers must feel like celebrities.” Aelriss says. “You think you could have done what the Alliance leaders did, if you'd gotten to Averron first?”

“Maybe.” You respond. “I doubt it's completely luck, if that's what you're asking. I'm not saying I couldn't, but some of them are pretty good. I'm sure Liza is, anyway, and Ayla treats this game like it's rocket science. It's crazy.”

Aelriss nods, looking a bit despondent.

“Really?” You ask. “That upsets you? You know you've got one of the only Celestial Artifacts in the game, right? And a fucking strong one, to boot. Go wave that around and see how many people stick to you.”

“Oh, please.” She chuckles. “Go on.”

> [[ Continued ]]
name: Sylvetica

>>38202832

"I see. Just fishing for compliments, then?" You roll your eyes and wave her off, looking toward Tatsumaki, who's standing awkwardly to the side as usual. “Tatsumaki, what about you? Interested in joining a guild?”

She looks up at you briefly, then tilts her head to one side.

“I mean, if you had to.” You add.

There's a contracted pause, and she points to the Guardians' hall.

“Mhm.” You nod. “Ael, looks like we've got you beat two to one.”

“Ugh, it's not a vote.” She shakes her head. “Anyway, Ashe. How long are you gonna be online?”

“Iunno.” You respond. “I was thinking about going to a thing in a little while, but I've basically got all day otherwise. Why's that?”

“Not sure. Tatsumaki and I want to do something, but we're not sure what.” She says. “Ah, nice breastplate, by the way.”

“Thanks.” You respond. “Looks like you two did some shopping yourselves.”

“Most definitely.” Aelriss tugs on the collar of her chain-mail. “I'm wearing actual armor now, which is cool. Tatsumaki burned her cash on some new gauntlets, and gave me an earth focus to power 'em up with. I just re-committed my PP for Eunoia, so I'm ready for whatever.”

“Alright, then. How about the Inner Sanctum?” You ask. “Do you guys want to wait for Nel to come online?”

Tatsumaki nods.

“Ah, you guys were doing that dungeon in the ruins, right? The cathedral.” Aelriss says. “If your friend was there with you, then it's really only fair to wait for him. Unless you don't want to. I'd want to wait for Donnel myself, but it's fine if that's not alright with you.”

“No, no.” You shake your head. “I was just getting your opinions. I'm sure there's stuff we can do until then. Anyone feel like farming?”

“Sounds fine with me.” Aelriss responds. “Let's see, there's always Crawlers. Then the stone guys are pretty easy to blow up. I'm sure there's plenty of stuff in the branch with that cathedral that we haven't seen yet. Though... Nameless could attack again. And that Anaximander...”

“They could attack anywhere.” You sigh, shaking your head. “Hell, Anaximander can apparently teleport long distances. I'm not sure where he's hiding, or how accurate his ability is. But presumably, all it takes is a spy.”

Nel, Donnel, and Vision are offline.

Aelriss, Ayla, Smith, and Tatsumaki are online.

comment:
>>38205222

“Smith.” You wave as you pass through the gates. Aelriss and Tatsumaki shrink behind you.

“Good to see you again, Ascheritte.” Smith smiles, formal as always. You don't see any drones with him, but he can probably store them in his UI, which seems convenient. “You've got my chips?”

“Mhm.” You produce the luminescent diskettes and hand them over. “Didn't spend a cent of it.”

“I thank you.” He says. “What are you and your friends up to?”

“Not much. Maybe about to do some farming, maybe not.” You shrug. “You?”

“The usual.” Smith says. “And a bit of exploring. Looking for altars, and nice places. Haven't found much of anything exciting yet, though, and the message boards are down, which means maps of the furthest branches aren't being spread. You should carry exploring gear, though. The terrain gets quite nasty once you stray too far away from Averron.”

“Thanks. I'll keep that in mind.” You say. He nods and waves you off, making a cautious exit towards the far caves, periodically looking over his shoulder.

What will you do?
> Get to farming, starting with these stupid crawlers.
> Go find a better farming spot; like where you lost Rhett.
> Start exploring a different branch below.
> Other
name: Sylvetica

comment:
>>38207861

> [[ Critical Success ]]

You hate bugs.

There's a mound of red compound-eyes staring at you. It's skittering forward, scythe-like legs covered in chitinous armor. It's got enormous wings, and its abdomen resembles a bioluminescent, bulbous sac, webbed in bony armor plating.

You stride backwards, water and mud splashing from underfoot as you ready your bastard sword against the charge. It rears up, mouthparts clicking, hoping to impale you on one of its razor-sharp forelimbs, but makes the mistake of exposing the underbelly.

You stab it from beneath, and carry through, watching your sword emerge from its back as it towers over you, and cutting clean between the wings from head to tail.

> Ascheritte defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Aelriss, Tatsumaki ]]

You cut through that sac, and something pours out, causing you to rear back. It looks like blood at first, but it glows a bright orange and sizzles on contact with the ground below. Red rings swirl around your body: Haste.

Another one of them is coming at you from the front, and you hold it at bay with your sword, dodging left and right as the forelimbs bury themselves in the mud. There's an incessant buzzing from all around; it's like they're moving in formation, as two of them are engaged with both Tatsumaki and Aelriss.

Boom: the sound of earth breaking from Tatsumaki's direction. A reverberation echoes through the cave, and bits of rock fall from above.

> Tatsumaki defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Aelriss, Ascheritte ]]

A jet of orange liquid sails over your shoulder, barely missing you. The air is filled with an acrid stench, and you'd swear from the heat it was combusting on contact with oxygen. Aelriss is yelling loudly and incoherently.

> [[ Haste: Ascheritte is attacking and moving faster. ]]
> Clear yourself of targets.
> Pair up with Tatsumaki to finish these two.
> Back up Aelriss.
name: Sylvetica

comment:
>>38208483

You whirl around to face Aelriss and start moving in her direction. There's splashing and wingbeats from behind you, as the sliverwing gives chase. Their wings have a discomforting feathery texture, and leave something in the air like moth dust that stings your eyes.

Aelriss is ducking left and right, prodding with her staff, and Eunoia can't find an approach on either of the targets surrounding her. There's a faintly-glowing orange streak leading across the ground to her, and you can see the side of her face is burned pretty badly.

Well, at least she's good at dodging. You move forward rapidly, swinging wildly, and take the attention from one of them to make things easier. It's risky, but you dodge close to keep it in place so Eunoia can land on its back where its wings meet. The bird whistles merrily, and the silverwing seizes before rolling to one side, the glow in its eyes growing dim. Paralysis.

You take the opportunity, and put your blade through its head. Aelriss jumps around the other, knocking it into the dirt with a barreling swing of her staff that kicks up a small gust of wind. Artifice is no joke, it seems.

> Ascheritte defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Aelriss, Tatsumaki ]]
> Aelriss defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Tatsumaki, Ascheritte ]]

You're not glowing red anymore—wait, there's still one behind you!

> [[ 1d100 ]]

> [[ 85 ]]

An instinctive leap to the side. Normally, you'd dive-roll, but you don't want to roll around in this, even in a video game. A jet of visibly-burning liquid passes through the space you occupied a moment ago, and puddles at Aelriss's feet; she freezes for a second before stumbling backward, bumping into the cave wall.

“Aelriss, move!” You shout, whirling back around. You move back into range, dodging on the spot as forelimbs pass overhead. The sliverwing doubles back and crashes down, and you raise your blade to parry, stopping them a foot away from your face and forcing the thing back, spilling burning blood to the cave floor.

There's a sound, familiar though alien, a loud metallic screaming as a beam of searing golden light blasts into the sliverwing's side and sweeps across, dividing it in half horizontally and cauterizing the wound.

> Aelriss defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Tatsumaki, Ascheritte ]]

At just the right height, the beam carries through, flash-fusing the other one's carapace to its body. You don't waste time, charging forward by torchlight and finishing it off with a wide slash.

> Ascheritte defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Aelriss, Tatsumaki ]]

No more buzzing. You wave the torch around. There's a hole in the cave wall a distance away that looks like it leads down a narrow tunnel. This cavern, though, is quite spacious already. You hope there's no more sliverwings.

>>38208974

“Three-way split?” You ask. The group nods, and you continue. “What about the heart? Ael, can you—”

“Keep it.” She responds in a hurry, rummaging through her UI menu. Her voice sounds a little off, and you realize how bad that burn is; you can see teeth through the left side of her face. Otherwise intact, though. You wonder how much HP she's lost. Eunoia perches on her shoulder, and she begins applying bandages.

“That didn't hurt, did it?”

“It doesn't hurt.” She snaps.

“Alright, then.” You say. “Tatsumaki, are you alright with that?”

She nods, and presents her gauntleted hand, stirring the haze rising off of it with her other index finger. She looks a little scuffed up, probably from hitting the ground, but otherwise alright. You squint a bit, as there's still dust lingering in the air.

Loot distributed, you quietly make your way up to the opening, half-crawling up a mound of gravel and old bones. The cavern is dark, and appears to spiral a short ways downward. You hear snoring from inside.

Closer to the walls, you raise and wave your torch wide. There's a lot of holes in the wall that look like sliverwing hives; the tunnels have a black, gooey appearance, carved with scythe-like claws and shaped with burning spittle. You think you see egg sacs.
